RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 1 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 96. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 28900. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR PENNSYLVANIA BRED OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Si nce April 17 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since March 17 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $25,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FAMISHED vied for the lead on the inside and made a bid to shake clear on the turn in the two path, then was headed nearing the furlong marker but turned back that bid in the furlong grounds to prove best under a drive. SALTO DE TIGRE tracked the early pace two wide, made a three wide bid nearing the quarter pole, then went on even terms for command by the furlong marker but hung, second best. MIDNIGHT ACT was well placed behind the vying leaders on the inside, then steadied nearing the three eighths marker and fell back, then got back into stride to advanced into the lane and was no threat to top two while besting the rest. TRENDING UP was settled early, three wide on the turn and between rivals at the five sixteenth and came four wide into the lane and was empty. MOON WARRIOR was settled four wide, came five wdie into the lane and weakened. PURPLE SHIRT showed no speed and failed to menace. GLOBAL SENSATION vied for the lead three wide and stopped.

ENTRY.NAME: Purple Shirt
ENTRY.COMMENT: void early speed, failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Midnight Act
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed inside, steadied 3/8 pole, bested rest

ENTRY.NAME: Salto de Tigre
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 2 wide, bid 3 wide, hung, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Famished
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead inside, bid turn, clear, headed,turned back bid

ENTRY.NAME: Global Sensation
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead 3 wide, stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Trending Up
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 3 wide turn, between 5/16, came 4 wide, empty,

ENTRY.NAME: Moon Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 4 wide turn, came 5 wide, weakened,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 2 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 10800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE NOVEMBER 17. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 17 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: I SEE THE STARS vied for the lead outside of trio into the turn, then made a three wide bid nearing the five sixteenths and drew clear by the quarter pole, then held sway late to prove best, driving. AGAINST THE ODDS was settled early on the inside, advanced on the inside to the quarter pole, then eased off the inside and came four wide into the lane while making a bid, closed well but could not get to the winner missed. TRUE GOLD chased the pace three wide and was four wide on the turn and came six wide into the lane and was along for the show award. BERHANU vied for the lead between rivals, weakened and lost the show award late. LONGTAIL vied for the lead on the inside and weakened. SPIN CYCLE was reserved two wide, came four wide into the lane and had no response.

ENTRY.NAME: Against the Odds
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle inside, eased out 1/4, came 4 wide, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Longtail
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead inside, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: True Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace, 3-4 wide turn, came 6 wide, up for show

ENTRY.NAME: Spin Cycle
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved 2 wide, came 4 wide, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Berhanu
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead between horses, weakened, lost 3rd late

ENTRY.NAME: I See the Stars
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead outside trio, bid 3 wide, drew clear, held sway

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 77. Claiming Purse 13100. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE NOVEMBER 17. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 17 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, if for $6,000, al lowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $5,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHATTER ME was away alertly and soon clear and well rated on the lead, let out a notch leaving the turn and quickly drew off, then was given a few pops with the riding crop leaving the furlong marker and then was wrapped up the final sixteenth to prove much the best. SERENE WARRIOR tracked the early pace and made a three wide mild bid nearing the quarter pole, but prove to be no match for the winner while saving the place award. FIVE DAYS IN MAY was rated along four wide, came five wide into the lane and lacked a rally, missed place award. HELLO GRACIE chased the pace on the inside and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Hello Gracie
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace inside, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Five Days in May
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated 4 wide, came 5 wide, needed rally, missed 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Shatter Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, soon clear, drew off upper, wrapped up 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Serene Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 3 wide, mild bid 3 wide 1/4, no match, saved 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 4 1M Dirt CR: 78. Claiming Purse 15400. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since April 17 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since March 17 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Pric e $10,000, if for $9,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FORECLOSURE was reluctant to load, rated between rivals, then went up between rivals to press the pace by the half mile marker, made a three wide bid off the turn and drew clear in the furlong grounds to prove best under a drive. COUSIN BOB vied for the early lead on the inside, then was between rivals in the two path by the half mile marker, continued to vie for command between rivals to the quarter pole and then angled out leaving the furlong marker and held the place award. BLUEBERRY MASH was rated early on the inside, then made a early bid to sneak up the rail to vie for command by thew half mile marker, then continued to vie on the rail to the quarter pole but faded the final furlong, missed place award. SWEEPIN HARD was reserved early on the inside, came six wide into the lane and had a belated rally for the minor rewards. MR BOLDACIOUS was four wide into the first turn, stalked the pace four wide and weakened. MAGNETIC CHARM vied for the early lead three wide, then was four wide on the far turn and tired in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Sweepin Hard
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved inside, came 6 wide upper stretch, belatedly

ENTRY.NAME: Cousin Bob
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied inside, between horses 1/2, angled out 1/8, held 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Blueberry Mash
ENTRY.OWNER: Short Straw Stable and Haire Maria Montez
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated inside, early bid, vied inside, faded 1/8, missed 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Foreclosure
ENTRY.COMMENT: reluctant,rated between rivals, bid 3 wide, drew clear, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Magnetic Charm
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead 3 wide, 4 wide turn, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Boldacious
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4 wide first turn, stalked pace 4 wide, weakened,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 93. Claiming Purse 18100. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE FEBRUARY 17 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 17 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 17 Allow ed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, if for $14,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: YES SIR ROBERT vied for the early lead on the outside, made a three wide bid on the turn to draw clear, then drew off leaving the turn and was ridden out to the wire and remained clear. JUMPMASTER was rated early, saved ground and was blocked on the turn, eased off the inside and came four wide into the lane and finished well, second best. YES IT'S ROO was rated early between rivals, made a four wide move on the turn but finished evenly, bested rest. CARGO SHIP vied for the lead on the inside and weakened. BOX OF CHOCOLATES was settled early, ridden along five wide on the turn and had no rally. FEDERAL CASE was settled back early, came four wide into the lane and passed the tiring rivals. SPIKES SHIRL vied for the lead between rivals and weakened. MARTINKELLY was rated between rivals, in tight by the half mile marker and weakened. ACT OF VALOR tracked the early pace in between rivals and stopped.

ENTRY.NAME: Jumpmaster
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated inside, blocked 5/16, eased out, came 4 wide, finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Cargo Ship
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead inside, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Act of Valor
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace between horses, stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Martinkelly
ENTRY.OWNER: Two Ten Twelve Triple T Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated between horses, in tight 1/2, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Yes It's Roo
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated between horses, 4 wide move turn, flattened out, best rest

ENTRY.NAME: Spikes Shirl
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead between horses, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Federal Case
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled back, came 4 wide upper stretch, passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.NAME: Box of Chocolates
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled early, 5 wide turn, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Yes Sir Robert
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead outside, bid 3 wide, clear, drew off, ridden out,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 6 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 63. Claiming Purse 10800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since April 17 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ADY'S MUNNY set the pace while in the two path, drew off leaving the turn and widened the margin to prove much the best, driving. BUCK WILD was rated three wide, made a mild bid four wide by the quarter pole but proved to be no match for the winner but clearly second best. BUFF AND SHINE stalked the pace three wide and weakened, held show award. RIVERBOAT BANDIT was bumped at the start, settled back early, came three wide into the lane and then angled in leaving the furlong marker and improved late. SLINGSHOT BOY passed the tiring rivals. SUMMER ASH was settled four wide and tired. JACK SLYE was well placed on the inside and stopped. BRANTLEYS BIG GUN was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Slingshot Boy
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.NAME: Riverboat Bandit
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, settled back, came 3 wide, angled in, improved

ENTRY.NAME: Brantleys Big Gun
ENTRY.COMMENT: no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Buck Wild
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated 3 wide, mild bid 4 wide, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Jack Slye
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed inside, saved ground, stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Ady's Munny
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace 2 wide, drew off upper stretch, widened, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Summer Ash
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 4 wide backstretch, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Buff and Shine
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 3 wide, weakened, held show

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 7 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 11800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE NOVEMBER 17 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since April 17 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Ra ce Since March 17 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FACTOTUM set a pressured pace on the inside, drew clear by the quarter pole and then drew off leaving the turn and then remained well clear to prove best, driving. POLITICAL was settled back early, made a four wide move on the turn and finished willingly to be clearly second best. ALL TIME CLASSIC pressed the winner three wide and weakened, bested rest. WHATA GUY tracked the pace on the inside and weakened on the turn, eased off the inside and came three wide into the lane and tired in the drive. VISHNU was allowed to settle on the inside and then failed to menace. LTL BEAR SALOON tracked the pace three wide and then tired after six furlongs. ANTE UP ALEX showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: Factotum
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace inside, bid turn, drew off upper, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Vishnu
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle inside, failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: All Time Classic
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace 3 wide, weakened, bested rest

ENTRY.NAME: Ltl Bear Saloon
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 3 wide, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Whata Guy
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace inside, weakened turn, came 3 wide, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Political
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled back, 4 wide move, willingly, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Ante Up Alex
ENTRY.OWNER: Fanelli John and Longball Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: showed little,
